channel.title: Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Azure Boards integration with GitHub Copilot
item.description: A few months ago we introduced the Azure Boards integration with GitHub Copilot in private preview. The goal was simple: allow teams to take a work item from Azure Boards and send it directly to GitHub Copilot so the coding agent Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/github-copilot-for-azure-boards

item.title: Build declarative agents for Microsoft 365 Copilot with MCP
item.description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is revolutionizing AI by providing a universal integration standard for the external systems, unlocking unprecedented capabilities, transforming how AI models access and utilize real-time data. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/build-declarative-agents-for-microsoft-365-copilot-with-mcp

item.title: How to Build iOS Widgets with .NET MAUI
item.description: This is a guest blog from Toine de Boer. I'm a .NET developer primarily focused on .NET MAUI to ASP.NET backend services. Because I recently have worked a lot with Widgets and encountered many obstacles and very limited documentation in the initial phas Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/how-to-build-ios-widgets-with-dotnet-maui

item.title: Behind the scenes of the Visual Studio feedback system
item.description: Here on the Visual Studio team, our top priority is making your coding experience smoother and more enjoyable. And that begins with truly listening to your feedback. We understand that sometimes sharing your thoughts can feel like tossing bug reports and suggestions into a black hole. It doesn’t feel good, and we get it. But here’s the Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/behind-the-scenes-of-the-visual-studio-feedback-system

item.title: Misunderstanding what the Cricket Celebration Bowl is
item.description: Apparently, late last week was an event known as the Cricket Celebration Bowl. I thought to myself, "The Cricket Celebration Bowl sounds like the name of the least popular item on the Panera menu." And no, it's not a cricket match either. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251215-01/?p=111871

item.title: Resolving an ambiguity in the Windows clipboard automated text conversion table
item.description: Last time, we encountered a mystery where the synthesis of CF_OEM­TEXT from CF_TEXT did not use Ansi­To­Oem. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251212-05/?p=111862

item.title: Retirement of Global Personal Access Tokens in Azure DevOps
item.description: In the new year, we’ll be retiring the Global Personal Access Token (PAT) type in Azure DevOps. Global PATs allow users to authenticate across all accessible organizations. While this can feel convenient, a single credential with broad reach creates a concentrated security risk — especially as a user’s access Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/retirement-of-global-personal-access-tokens-in-azure-devops

item.title: Studying the various locale mismatch scenarios in Windows clipboard text format synthesis
item.description: So far, we've learned that the conversion between Unicode and the 8-bit ANSI and OEM code pages is performed with the assistance of the CF_LOCALE clipboard format, which itself c Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251211-37/?p=111858

item.title: Making Windows Terminal awesome with GitHub Copilot CLI
item.description: As someone who lives and breathes in the command line, I love making my terminal feel like home. Windows Terminal is full of personalization options that really allow for a custom experience. Additionally, I can stay within my terminal for my development with GitHub Copilot with the GitHub Copilot CLI. Let's walk through how you can trick out Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/making-windows-terminal-awesome-with-github-copilot-cli

item.title: Aspire Integrations, Batteries Included
item.description: Aspire Integrations: Batteries included Modern applications depend on many external services: databases, caches, message brokers, storage layers, observability tools, and sometimes AI systems. Each of these brings its own rules for configuration, connection strings, environment variables, authentication, and deployment. Setting al Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/aspire/aspire-integrations-batteries-included

item.title: Azure Cosmos DB vNext Emulator: Query and Observability Enhancements
item.description: The Azure Cosmos DB Linux-based vNext emulator (preview) is a local version of the Azure Cosmos DB service that runs as a Docker container on Linux, macOS, and Windows. It provides a cost-effective way to develop and test applications locally without requiring an Azure Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/azure-cosmos-db-vnext-emulator-query-and-observability-enhancements

item.title: Azure Cosmos DB : Becoming a Search-Native Database
item.description: For years, “Database” and “Search systems" (think Elastic Search) lived in separate worlds. While both Databases and Search Systems operate in the same domain (storing, indexing and querying data), they prioritized different aspects. OLTP Databases prioritized Structured and Semi-structured data Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/azure-cosmos-db-becoming-a-search-native-database

item.title: General Availability of SharePoint Framework 1.22 - A Major Refresh of the Build & Tooling Experience
item.description: We are excited to announce general availability of the SharePoint Framework (SPFx) 1.22 – with a focus on refreshing the build and toolchain areas. SharePoint Framework is the easiest and the most widely used model to build your enterprise solutions for Microsoft 365 with automatic single s Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/general-availability-of-sharepoint-framework-1-22-a-major-refresh-of-the-build-tooling-experience

item.title: Streamlining your Git workflow with Visual Studio 2026
item.description: You’re a .NET developer with a busy morning, and an Azure DevOps ticket drops: “Login endpoint 500s under load.” You’ve got to fix it, review a teammate’s feature branch, and keep your repo clean - all before lunch. Visual Studio’s Git tools turn this everyday Git workflow of creating topic branches, stashing changes, committing, a Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/streamlining-your-git-workflow-with-visual-studio-2026

item.title: Announcing Azure DevOps Server General Availability
item.description: We’re thrilled to announce that Azure DevOps Server is now generally available (GA)! This release marks the transition from the Release Candidate (RC) phase to full production readiness, delivering enterprise-grade DevOps capabilities fo Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/announcing-azure-devops-server-general-availability

item.title: .NET and .NET Framework December 2025 servicing releases updates
item.description: Welcome to our combined .NET servicing updates for December 2025. Let's get into the latest release of .NET & .NET Framework, here is a quick overview of what's new in our servicing releases: Update Overview .NET and .NET Framework has been refreshed with the latest update as of December 09, 2025. This update contains non-securi Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-and-dotnet-framework-december-2025-servicing-updates

item.title: Blue-green deployment in Azure Container Apps using Azure Developer CLI
item.description: Blue-green deployment in Azure Container Apps using Azure Developer CLI If you follow the Azure Developer CLI blog posts, you already know that Azure Container Apps (ACA) support in Azure Developer CLI (azd) is GA. We want azd to be production-ready—you should be a Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-developer-cli-azd-blue-green-aca-deployment

item.title: Implementing Cross-Platform In-App Billing in .NET MAUI Applications
item.description: With the discontinuation of the popular InAppBillingPlugin, many .NET MAUI developers have been looking for guidance on implementing in-app purchases in their applications. Today, we're sharing a comprehensive sample that demonstrates how to implement cross-platform billing Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/cross-platform-billing-dotnet-maui

item.title: Previewing the JavaScript/TypeScript Modernizer for VS Code Insiders
item.description: Previewing the JavaScript/TypeScript Modernizer for VS Code Insiders Keeping JavaScript/TypeScript projects up-to-date can be a challenge, especially when it’s time to upgrade a bunch of npm packages or adopt the latest frameworks. We’ve heard from many JS/TS developers that modernizing an older app (upgrading de Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/jsts-modernizer-preview

item.title: How does Windows synthesize CF_UNICODE­TEXT from CF_TEXT and vice versa?

item.title: Announcing Microsoft Entra PowerShell v1.1.0
item.description: We’re thrilled to introduce Microsoft Entra PowerShell v1.1.0 available on PowerShell Gallery. The headline feature is No more version pinning to Microsoft Graph PowerShell v2.25.0. You can now use the latest Graph modules wi Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/entrapowershell/announcing-microsoft-entra-powershell-v1-1-0

item.title: Entra PowerShell Now Supports Latest Microsoft Graph PowerShell Versions
item.description: We’ve heard you and we’ve made it happen! One of the most requested changes from our community has been greater flexibility when working with Microsoft Graph PowerShell. Previously, Entra PowerShell pinned its dependency to Microsoft Graph PowerShell v2.25, which limited customers from leveraging Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/entrapowershell/entra-powershell-now-supports-latest-microsoft-graph-powershell-versions
